column3:
I filled her in on the weekend's events, and she paled when I told her about the gunshot. "Thank the Lord you weren't hurt."
We discussed the incident a few minutes longer, and then I noticed the time. Four minutes before nine.
It was nearly nine o'clock and the sun was fiercer every minute.

It was Mrs. Poppets that woke me up next morning. She said: “Do you know that it’s nearly nine o’clock, sir?”
“Nine o’ what?” I cried, starting up.
“Nine o’clock,” she replied, through the keyhole. “I thought you was a- oversleeping yourselves.”
